The '''Triumphal arch''' is a [[monument]] situated in [[Central Chişinău]] next to the [[Nativity Cathedral, Chișinău|Nativity Cathedral]] on Piața Marii Adunǎri Naționale nr. 2 and directly opposite Government House.
== History ==
The Triumphal arch was built in 1840 by the architect I. Zauschevic and thanks to the [[:ro:Pavel Fiodorov|governor]]'s of [[Bessarabia]] initiative to commemorate the victory of the [[Russian Empire]] over the [[Ottoman Empire]] during the [[Russo-Turkish War (1828–29)]]. From its construction to 2011 the monument sheltered at its second level a huge bell of nearly 6400 kg (400 Puduri). It was smelted with the copper of the cannons captured by the Russian forces from the Ottoman Empire. The bell "clopote–velican" was initially made for the [[Nativity Cathedral, Chișinău|cathedral's]] belfry but happened to be too big for it. Finally it was installed in this arch, which was designed in purpose. The monument and the mechanism of its clock were fully restored in 1973.
